name: Papercuts (Thomas Sauerzapf)
description:
Erik Pevernagie once said: “If the glare of the public eye has become unbearable, our inner child may claim its rights and our bodily shadow might turn into our mental second self, become our anchor, make us stay grounded and grant us deepness and intensity. By retreating from the blaze of display into our substantial self, we gain rootedness, insight and new worldly wisdom." In this game you´ll be making your way through the life of an adult, searching for something she had once lost and wasn´t able to find for a long time. Through this game you will be confronted with an experience of the dreary working life of an adult and a little companion who is always tagging along!

This game was made in 96 hours during Global Game Jam 2021.
